body: NP. If you need my help on other task. Ping me heavily. I might miss reading the message.
closes [ZOOKEEPER-3596](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-3596)

@evans-ye, I found the 'worker' image https://hub.docker.com/r/bigtop/prestosql-worker
But 'coordinator' does not exist yet. Please build the 'coordinator' image too https://github.com/apache/bigtop/tree/cnb/prestosql/docker/coordinator
@kwmonroe
@kwmonroe
@jlosito, please close per comment on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3270.  We don't want to set a series in individual charm metadata, even though `charm build` may complain about it.
Thanks @guyuqi for the fix.
@kwmonroe the ticket marked as resolved. i'm closing this one out.

Hey @guyuqi  Thanks for the patch. However, we're intentionally not allowing to build pkgs as root. See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-2722 for the details. In general, if you run ./gradlew tez-pkg-ind you should not face this problem. Did you try to build tez inside a container?

Next time you can post a question on the mailing first so that we can discuss and get you to the right direction.

@evans-ye , it's sloppy for me to post #560 before background investigation. Really thanks for your suggestion.  
#560 is closed.

Patch looks great! Let me run through the CI and get back to you.

Hi @evans-ye ,
Pls forgive my late response to your question.

For Ambari  provides easy-to-use Hadoop management web UI, I'm sorry that I didn't take some scripts to deploy Ambari but took manual depolyment with BGTP Mpack by accessing Ambari web UI.
 
The Centos deployment steps are as follows:
1. Prepare 3 Nodes: 
```
Node1: ambari-server
Node2: ambari-agent01
Node3: ambari-agent02

```
2.  Install ambari-server.rpm on ambari server and ambari-agent.rpm on ambari agents respectively.

3. Modify Ambari server hostname to `/etc/ambari-agent/conf/ambari-agent.ini` which is located on Ambari agent nodes.

4. Install chrony and start chronyd service for time-sync among nodes.

5. Install  bgtp-mapck on Ambari server:
`sudo ambari-server install-mpack --mpack=/path/bgtp-ambari-mpack-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-bgtp-ambari-mpack.tar.gz --purge --verbose`
path is  `/var/lib/ambari-server/resources` that defines in `install_ambari.sh` .

6. Restart Ambari server and agents
Ambari server node: `ambari-server restart`
Ambari agents: `ambari-agent restart`

7. Access Ambari webui:
```
ambari-server-ip:8080 
admin/admin
```

8. Deploy Hadoop by Ambari facility.

This mpack may be regarded  as a minimal definition. It just includes hdfs, mapreduced, yarn and zookeeper services in it. We will add more services to it in future.

I would like to add deployment document like `Readme `to `bigtop-packages/src/common/ambari/`.

And the ambari smoke test module was deprecated and doesn't work by using Odpi stack.
Please give me few days to add new smoke tests by using this new Bgtp stack.
@evans-ye , added smoke tests for Elasticsearch. Pls review.

@guyuqi sorry for the delay. I'm trying this. 

So /path/bgtp-ambari-mpack-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-bgtp-ambari-mpack.tar.gz is packaged by bigtop and installed via ambari-server or amber-agent.rpm?

Let's see how CI works:
https://ci.bigtop.apache.org/view/Test/job/Build-Deploy-Smoke-Test-Pull-Request-All-Distros/25/
Looks good. Let me test this.

The `bgtp-ambari-mpack-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-bgtp-ambari-mpack.tar.gz ` would be put on `/var/lib/ambari-server/resources`  by ambari-server deb/rpm installation, but not be installed yet.

The `bgtp-ambari-mpack-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-bgtp-ambari-mpack.tar.gz ` would be installed by depolyment script. 

In bigtop, we installed it by puppet ( `bigtop-deploy/puppet/modules/ambari/manifests/init.pp`) : 
` command => "/bin/bash -c 'echo yes | /usr/sbin/ambari-server install-mpack --purge --verbose --mpack=/var/lib/ambari-server/resources/bgtp-ambari-mpack-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-bgtp-ambari-mpack.tar.gz'",`

The user could either install mpack via installing command( `ambari-server install-mpack` ) manually or define this command in their own depolyment script.

In https://ci.bigtop.apache.org/view/Test/job/Build-Deploy-Smoke-Test-Pull-Request-All-Distros/25/:
```
ERROR: Failed to clean the workspace
jenkins.util.io.CompositeIOException: Unable to delete
 '/home/jenkins/workspace/Build-Deploy-Smoke-Test-Pull-Request-All-Distros/OS/ubuntu-16.04-arm64-deploy'. 
Tried 3 times (of a maximum of 3) waiting 0.1 sec between attempts.

```
It seems the permission issues when it tried to delete the directory which was created by 'root'.
It seems between step 5 and 6,  we need to perform *ambari-server setup*?

I'm super new to ambari. Can you guide me through what need to be done at this page?

![Screen Shot 2020-01-20 at 12 56 55 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2102804/72684938-cf875800-3b1f-11ea-9815-f5b5e7fd1354.png)

It seems mapck repo format is not correct.
I updated PR to modify the repo base url.

Before Ambari server start,
1. Let's reset ambari and install mapck firstly:
```
ambari-server reset

ambari-server install-mpack --purge --verbose --mpack=/var/lib/ambari-server/resources/bgtp-ambari-mpack-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-bgtp-ambari-mpack.tar.gz
```

2. Ambari server setup with default configuration:
`ambari-server setup`

3. Start server and agent
```
On server node: ambari-server start
On agent nodes: ambari-agent start
```
I also posted a depolyment video  [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vnyUQtF8ZyM). 
:-)

In the demo video above:
I pick my local repo for packages installation.

In this PR, we use the bigtop official repo for packages installation like: 
`http://repos.bigtop.apache.org/releases/1.4.0/centos/7/$basearch  
 http://repos.bigtop.apache.org/releases/1.4.0/ubuntu/16.04/$(ARCH)
`


And ambari web ui may not be resolve `$(ARCH)` and `$basearch`.
So please skip repo base validation on Ambari Web-UI:

![Inkedambari-skip_LI](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20575685/72711237-9264a980-3ba3-11ea-9a1c-afefb619419b.jpg)

creating cluster by docker provisioner worked for me.

```
$ cd provisioner/docker
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh --create 5
```

runnign smoke tests is wip.

While Hadoop updated the versino of bundled Tomcat to 8.5 ( [HADOOP-16439](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-16439) ), hadoop-httpfs of Bigtop depends on bigtop-tomcat which is depended by other producs such as Sqoop and Oozie. I would like to address updating Tomcat in follow-up JIRAs.
Smoke-tests of hdfs, yarn, mapreduce are passed on my local docker provisioned 3 node cluster on CentOS 7.
Thanks! Let me try this during lunar new year holiday.
Following the CTR model, I'm going to commit this because it's tested for all distros and over 24 hours has passed since it was submitted.

@iwasakims Have you ever seen this error?
Thanks for the comment, @oflebbe. I updated the patch to retain the license URL.

> [ERROR] Exit code: 1 - javadoc: error - class file for org.apache.yetus.audience.InterfaceAudience not found

Hmm, I haven't seen the error. Hadoop itself does not use the org.apache.yetus.audience.InterfaceAudience in the code. I suspected [BIGTOP-3279](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3279) is relevant since zookeeper-3.4.13 uses the class but I can not reproduce the error by applying the patch of this PR to current master branch on CentOS7.
Thanks, @oflebbe.

I could not reproduce the error on CentOS 8. Building fails due to another reason. We need the patch of [HADOOP-16739](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-16739) to fix this. 

```
[WARNING] /srcs/bigtop/build/hadoop/rpm/BUILD/hadoop-2.10.0-src/hadoop-tools/hadoop-pipes/src/main/native/utils/impl/SerialUtils.cc:22:10: fatal error: rpc/types.h: No such file or directory
[WARNING]  #include <rpc/types.h>
[WARNING]           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
[WARNING] compilation terminated.
[WARNING] make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/hadooputils.dir/build.make:76: CMakeFiles/hadooputils.dir/main/native/utils/impl/SerialUtils.cc.o] Error 1
```

I would like to address issues on RHEL/CentOS 8 in follow-up JIRAs.

> I suspected BIGTOP-3279 is relevant since zookeeper-3.4.13 uses the class

You're right. The `./gradlew hadoop-pkg -Dbuildwithdeps=true` command I executed builds zk first, and [it installs the generated jars into the local .m2 repository](https://github.com/apache/bigtop/blob/ab8208768ce93c7c5ef119779e179e86dec3ac81/bigtop-packages/src/common/zookeeper/do-component-build#L30-L31).
I succeeded in building Hadoop by removing those jars and running the same command without the `-Dbuildwithdeps=true` option, so probably there's something wrong in the zk's build process. I'll address that in another issue.

> I would like to address issues on RHEL/CentOS 8 in follow-up JIRAs.

Sounds good to me. Will commit this PR.
Only rpm fixes are available now. Fixes for deb is wip.

I manually tested that hadoop-kms service starts and `hadoop key` works after `sudo yum install hadoop-kms`.

Keystore password must set set before starting hadoop-kms service. You may need to set JAVA_OPTS to make Tomcat bind ipv4 address depending on the OS settings.
```
$ sudo bash -c 'echo "export HADOOP_KEYSTORE_PASSWORD=mysecret" >> /etc/hadoop-kms/conf/kms-env.sh'
$ sudo bash -c 'echo "export JAVA_OPTS=\"\$JAVA_OPTS -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -Djava.net.preferIPv4Addresses=true \"" >> /etc/hadoop-kms/conf/kms-env.sh'
$ sudo service hadoop-kms start
```

Client-side settings must be set in /etc/hadoop/conf/core-site.xml.
```
  <property>
    <name>hadoop.security.key.provider.path</name>
    <value>kms://http@localhost:16000/kms</value>
  </property>
```

Let me try to get around this.

 In the meantime, I've looked into the PR again. I've concern on how ODPi's mpack work. It seems the JAR/binary is contained in the patch file, making the patch 20MB large. 
Can we get ride of this? Why the jars need to be included instead of fetched and packaged?

smoke_test_components: [hbase]

https://phoenix.apache.org/download.html
> Apache HBase 2.0 is supported by 5.0.0

So if you would like to upgrade HBase 2, we need to bump up Phoenix version to 5.0.0-HBase-2.0 as well.
I think we can merge this first and then tackle on Phoenix in another JIRA, how do you think?
@youngwookim Phoenix is planned to be updated too in [BIGTOP-3284](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3284). I will work on it next.

[PHOENIX-4836](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-4836) says that phoenix-5 does not support hadoop-2.. If we use hadoop-2.10.0, hbase-1.5.0 and phoenix-4.15.0-HBase-1.5 could be the candidate.

Thanks, Evans! 
Let me look into it and try to figure it out .

Sounds like a plan. Let's move on to what you suggested and left this for the future release.

```
$ sudo apt install hadoop-kms
$ sudo /bin/bash -c 'echo export HADOOP_KEYSTORE_PASSWORD=mysecret >> /etc/hadoop-kms/conf/kms-env.sh'
$ sudo service hadoop-kms start

$ hadoop key create testkey
testkey has been successfully created with options Options{cipher='AES/CTR/NoPadding', bitLength=128, description='null', attributes=null}.
org.apache.hadoop.crypto.key.kms.LoadBalancingKMSClientProvider@1bb266b3 has been updated.

$ hadoop key list
Listing keys for KeyProvider: org.apache.hadoop.crypto.key.kms.LoadBalancingKMSClientProvider@3cc1435c
testkey
```

+1, I confirmed that `./gradlew hive-pkg` succeeded at least on CentOS 7 and 8, Debian 9 and Ubuntu 16.04 and 18.04.
Thanks, @sekikn.

This looks like the issue around maven as reported in [HBase ML](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/0c39364a2949fab134107eaf164723e09d895b3eb2c16610b841e033%40%3Cuser.hbase.apache.org%3E) and [HBASE-21513](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-21513). The error can be reproduced on Ubuntu 18.04 but not on CentOS 7 for me. While the root cause is unclear, workaround is separating `site` phase from other mvn invocation.

+1, confirmed the PR worked on the following distros:

- CentOS 7 and 8
- Debian 9 and 10
- Ubuntu 16.04 and 18.04
Thanks, @sekikn .

+1, I confirmed the PR worked on Ubuntu 16.04/18.04 and did not introduce any problem on CentOS 7 and Debian 9/10.

@iwasakims I submitted a PR based on HADOOP-16739 so that we can build and test other components which depends on Hadoop on CentOS 8.
This PR also fixes an conditional error for Fedora 31 in `bigtop_toolchain/manifests/packages.pp`.

I confirmed that the following commands succeeded:

```
$ cd docker/bigtop-slaves
$ for i in centos-7 centos-8 fedora-31; do ./build.sh trunk-$i; done
$ cd -
$ for i in centos-7 centos-8 fedora-31; do ./gradlew hadoop-clean; ./gradlew hadoop-pkg-ind -POS=$i; done
```
LGTM. +1.
